title: The spirit of Alexander the copper-smith lately revived, now justly rebuk'd, or, An answer to a late pamphlet, intituled, The spirit of the hat, or the government of the Quakers in which the confederacy is broken, and the devil's champions defeated / by a true witness of the one way of God, W.P. ; to which are added the testimonies of those persons whose names are chiefly quoted by the author of that pamphlet.
author: Penn, William, 1644-1718.
notes: Signed in full by William Penn on p. 16.
"The spirit of the hat" was written by William Mucklow.
Reproduction of original in Bodleian Library.
